intro: Perezia carduncelloides, commonly known as the woolly carduncelloid, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its soft, fuzzy leaves and yellow flower heads that resemble small dandelions. Native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile, this plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant's unique appearance and adaptability make it an interesting subject for botanical study. It is often found growing in rocky soils and along dry riverbanks.
